Description: Wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) black-figure pottery bowl; interior: streaky brown glaze with incised lotus flower painted red and white; exterior, cream slip: body of lion (?) facing right, with red additions on limbs and body; filling ornaments: roundels and rays; incised details on lion and filling ornament; below, black band with superimposed white and red bands.
Curator's comments: Part of 1888,0601.534a-e & g, from high on the wall.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.231)
